Exclusive: Alexx, Vishakha & Kashika on Bollywood's unseen battles and the reforms it
description: Bollywood is an industry that thrives on spectacle. Headlines are dominated by opening-day numbers, star fees, social media virality and box-office verdicts delivered within hours of a release. This ETimes piece moves the spotlight away from gossip and toward growth. By listening closely to voices from within the industry—actor Alexx O’Nell, actor-producer-entrepreneur Vishakha Singh and actor Kashika Kapoor—it explores the invisible pressures Bollywood normalises, the silences it rewards, and the reforms that could make it a healthier ecosystem for the next generation.

‘Misleading narrative’: Chirag jibes oppn over G RAM G protest, calls it ‘help’ in Bengal polls
description: Union minister Chirag Paswan accused the Congress and RJD of spreading a misleading narrative around government schemes like VB-G RAM G, claiming their protests would electorally benefit the NDA. Paswan defended the new scheme, emphasizing collective responsibility and improved focus on infrastructure projects, while criticizing the Congress for alleged corruption in MGNREGA.

title: Watch: Fire breaks out in cinema hall in Odisha; major mishap averted
description: A minor fire broke out at Ashok Talkies in Rayagada during the screening of 'The Raja Saab', causing brief panic among moviegoers. The incident occurred when an aarti plate slipped and fell on papers near the screen, igniting them. Prompt action by staff and audience members quickly extinguished the flames, with no injuries or damage reported.

title: India talks diversity, but most companies employ less than 1% people with disabilities
description: India’s corporate diversity narrative falters when it comes to disability inclusion. Despite strong laws and public commitments, most companies employ fewer than 1 per cent persons with disabilities, according to the Marching Sheep PwD Inclusion Index 2025. The gap reflects systemic barriers, not lack of talent, locking millions of capable Indians out of formal employment.

title: Narrow escape in Bengaluru: Chilling CCTV footage shows speeding car ramming into Indiranagar restaurant, video sparks outrage
‘Journey from 20% to 30% & 40% won’t be that long’: Shah says BJP vote share rising in Kerala
description: Union home minister Amit Shah expressed confidence in the BJP's growing support in Kerala, predicting a victory in the upcoming Assembly elections. He highlighted the party's increasing vote share and recent local body successes, attributing them to dedicated workers.

title: Bangladeshi umpire officiates IND vs NZ ODI amid Mustafizur row - who is he?
description: As per ICC regulations, umpires for ODIs are appointed under specific clauses. Clause 2.1.4 states that the ICC shall appoint one umpire for each ODI, who must not be from the same country as the participating teams and must be from the Elite Panel or International Panel. Clause 2.1.5 says the home board shall appoint one umpire.

‘Legitimate targets’: Iran warns US of retaliation; Israel on alert — will Trump order a strike?
description: Iran's leadership faces escalating protests, now in their third week, with over 116 reported deaths. Amidst this unrest, Israel is on high alert as US President Trump reportedly considers military action. Iran has issued a stern warning, deeming regional US bases and Israel as 'legitimate targets' if attacked.

title: Drama at sacked IAS Puja Khedkar’s home: Family allegedly tied up, drugged & robbed — how it unfolded
description: Pune police are investigating claims by former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar. She alleges a recently hired domestic help from Nepal drugged her and her parents, tied them up, and stole valuables and mobile phones from their Baner Road residence. Khedkar managed to free herself and alert authorities.

title: Indian Railways reservation: From Jan 12, Aadhaar-authenticated IRCTC users can book train tickets till midnight
When disasters strike, preparation saves lives — is India ready when crisis hits?
description: India faces escalating disaster risks due to geography, climate change, and development patterns, as starkly illustrated in 2025 by devastating floods and heatwaves. While response capacity has improved, a persistent imbalance favors reactive relief over proactive preparedness, a gap highlighted by contrasting events like Cyclone Phailin and Bihar's recurring floods.

description: Investor Michael Burry, famous from 'The Big Short,' is betting against Oracle, citing concerns over its AI infrastructure expansion and significant debt.  He holds put options and has directly shorted the stock. Burry avoids shorting tech giants like Google and Microsoft, believing their core businesses offer stability despite AI investments.

Gateway to world: Kerala juice seller travels to 10 nations; China next on list
description: A humble sugarcane juice vendor from Kannur, Hashim VP, has turned his roadside stall into a launchpad for global exploration. For nearly three decades, his earnings have funded trips to ten countries, including Israel and Egypt. Now, the 67-year-old is preparing for his next adventure to China with his wife and brother, proving dreams can be realized through dedication.

Gisele Bündchen’s family preferred Tom Brady over Joaquim Valente: Report
description: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.

title: 1st Isro launch of 2026 will put another ‘eye in the sky’ tomorrow
Microsoft AI CEO: We're building superintelligence backwards; need controls before trust
description: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: China investigates Meta-Manus deal: Commerce ministry probes $2bn AI buy; Meta denies China links
description: Meta's acquisition of AI startup Manus, with Chinese roots, is under investigation by China for potential violations of technology export and outbound investment laws.  Despite Manus's move to Singapore and Meta's clarification on no continuing Chinese ownership, Beijing is scrutinizing the deal, citing the company's founding and parentage.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
description: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
description: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
description: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.
